edu.calpoly.twitter.util

Class Logger

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.calpoly.twitter.util.Logger

  • public class Logger
extends Object
    The Logger is a static class that takes care of logging. This class is actually a singleton, but no references will be made available. However, you should make sure to call Logger.init() before you try any logging. If you call init() multiple times, the Logger will check to make sure logging settings are the same. If they are different, new logs will be opened. If the Logger has not been init()'ed, it will try and init itself when a logging event occurs. This is moredangerious because the time that it picks up the logs to use is more unstable. Just call the static methods. There are five different levels of logging. INFO - logging with no level is an alias to logging with INFO. WARN DEBUG - Takes an optional Throwable. - Does not log to a database. ERROR - Takes an optional Throwable. FATAL - Takes an optional Throwable. FATALs will always terminate the current running instance. If there is an error in one level of logging, the error cascades down to more sever levels. (INFO, WARN, DEBUG) -> ERROR -> FATAL Besides logging to files, the Logger also logs to a common database.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private static class  Logger.LoggingTask
      Quick wrapper for logging information.
      private static class  Logger.LoggingThread
      A thread class to handle all asynchrounious logging tasks.
      private static class  Logger.LogLevel
      The different logging levels.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public static void init()
        Init the Logger. This will read file paths from Props. If it can't get the files, it will just print and die.

      • tearDown

        public static void tearDown()
        Tear down the Logger. This will kill the logging thread.

      • flush

        public static void flush()
        Flush all the logs. This should be unnecessary.

      • logInfo

        public static void logInfo(String message)
        Log the given message to the appropriate general log. Use this for general information. If there is an error writting to the normal log, an error will be logged to the error log.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to log.

      • log

        public static void log(String message)
        Alias for logInfo().

      • logError

        public static void logError(String message)
        Log the given message to the appropriate error log. Use this whenever an error occurs. For serious errors, use logFatal(String). If there is an error writting to the error log, an error will be logged to the fatal log.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to log.

      • logError

        public static void logError(String message,
            Throwable ex)
        Log the given message to the appropriate error log. Use this whenever an error occurs. For serious errors, use logFatal(String). If there is an error writting to the error log, an error will be logged to the fatal log.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to log.
        ex - Log the exception also.

      • logWarn

        public static void logWarn(String message)
        Log the given message to the appropriate alert log. Use this for alerts. If there is an error writting to the alert log, an error will be logged to the error log.
        Parameters:
        message - The alert to log.

      • logDebug

        public static void logDebug(String message)
        Log the given message to the appropriate debug log. Use this for debug information. If there is an error writting to the debug log, an error will be logged to the error log.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to log.

      • logDebug

        public static void logDebug(String message,
            Throwable ex)
        Log the given message to the appropriate debug log. Use this for debug information that has an Exception associated with it. If there is an error writting to the debug log, an error will be logged to the error log.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to log.
        ex - Log the exception also.

      • logFatal

        public static void logFatal(String message)
        Log the given message to the appropriate fatal log. Use this for SERIOUS errors. For general errors, use logError(String). If there is an error writting to the fatal log, an error will be printed to standard error.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to log.

      • logFatal

        public static void logFatal(String message,
            Throwable ex)
        Log the given message to the appropriate fatal log. Use this for SERIOUS errors. For general errors, use logError(String). If there is an error writting to the fatal log, an error will be printed to standard error.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to log.
        ex - Log the exception also.

      • log

        private static void log(String message,
       StackTraceElement caller,
       Logger.LogLevel level)
        Schedule a log.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to log.
        caller - Whoever called into the Logger.
        level - The level of logging that was used.

      • getHostname

        private static String getHostname()
        Get the hostname for this machine. If there is an error, 'UNKNOWN' will be returned.
        Returns:
        The hostname of the local machine, 'UNKNOWN' on error.
